oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Vermi-compost production to enterprise: case studies from Bangladesh
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hossain, Shaikh Tanveer
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil quality
Farm economics
Composting and manuring
Markets and trade
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In recent years organic agriculture practices have been gaining support from both consumers and producers in Bangladesh. Considering the economic benefits and environmental advantages, one such practice vermi-compost, or worm based composting, is growing in popularity with small-scale households. In the program study area it is fostering entrepreneurship, and with proper guidance and monitoring, is demonstrating that it can be a profitable enterprise.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Hossain, Shaikh Tanveer (2014) Vermi-compost production to enterprise: case studies from Bangladesh. Paper at: IFOAM Organic World Congress 2014, Istanbul, Turkey, 13-15 October 2014. [Completed]
